content: This study was published in NCUR 2014, National Conference of Undergraduate Research.
Created and tested visual learning tools for cognitive brain training and musical advancement
Highlights my attention to detail in evaluating a data graphic, music notation
Western music notation is generally intuitive, time reads left to right, and pitch up and down.
However, vertical spacing in Western music notation is inconsistent, same amount of vertical space can represent whole or half notes
Equal vertical space is given to major scale steps regardless of interval size.
Proposed this inconsistency creates problems for ear training, because the notation requires a high degree of familiarty with the major scale
Created hypothetical alternative notation system, Circle Notation (CN), to address the issue noted for Western music notation
Conducted an experiment with students with known levels of musical backgrounds
Test consisted of visual and audio questions.
Test yielded significant results for students with novice or intermediate experience, see exerpt question below with Traditional Notation (TN), Circle Notation (CN), also see results below
